summary: Save Bookmark Group over an existing Bookmark Group
description:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.1) Gecko/20020826
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.0; en-US; rv:1.1) Gecko/20020826

Something I've found myself wishing for quite frequently with bookmark groups is
the ability to overwrite a group bookmark with another one of the same name.

What I often do is visit several links that I want to read, and leave them up
until such time as it is convenient for me to do so.  However, if for some
reason I need to reboot or shutdown Mozilla before I get a chance to read
everything, I want to store off the bookmarks so I can resume where I left off.
 But I often want to keep re-using the same bookmark group, overwriting it with
my current working set of pages.  Unfortunately, that appears to require a
multi-step process right now:

1.  Bookmark this group of tabs - mouse, menu, navigate to location, and type in
a name
2.  Bookmarks->ManageBookmarks, navigate to existing "working set" group and
delete it.

So if I could overwrite the existing bookmark, my work would be cut in half. 
Then the next step would be if I could automate this process by designating one
such group bookmark as my official "working set" that could be stored and
retrieved with a single command or hotkey - i.e. without having to navigate the
bookmark hierarchy at all.
